abstract.text: A manager for recording and querying movement disorder data.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Only collect data from patients clinically diagnosed with a movement disorder. This API is not designed to collect data from users who have not been diagnosed with a movement disorder. All medical decisions should be made through the guidance of a licensed clinician. For more information, see
to measure a resting Parkinsonian tremor in the 3-7 Hz range and choreiform dyskinetic symptoms. When collecting data, the user should wear Apple Watch on their most affected arm.
requires an entitlement from Apple. To apply for the entitlement, see
To use this API, you must include the

file and provide a usage description string for this key. The usage description appears in the prompt that the user must accept the first time the system asks the user to access motion data for your app. If you don’t include a usage description string, your app crashes when you call this API.

abstract.text: Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.
A result object that contains data about the likely presence of dyskinetic symptoms during a one-minute interval.
A completion handler for processing dyskinetic symptom results.
A manager for recording and querying movement disorder data.
A value indicating whether the user has authorized the app to monitor and query for movement disorder data.
A Boolean value indicating whether the current device supports the movement disorder manager.
Returns the date of the most recently calculated results.
Calculate and store tremor and dyskinetic symptom results for the duration of the specified time interval.
Returns the expiration date for the most recent monitoring period.
Query for dyskinetic symptoms from the provided time interval.
Query for tremor results from the provided time interval.
Returns a string that describes the movement disorder algorithm’s current version.
A result object that contains data about the presence and strength of tremors during a one-minute interval.
A completion handler for accessing and processing tremor results.
Ensure that your users understand and have control over the data your app collects.

doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation.title: Adhering to the movement disorder data collection requirements

abstract.text: Retrieve data from the Apple Watch’s movement disorder manager.
A chronological log of notable changes to the movement disorder algorithm.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s motion data.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
